name: diffusively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves particles (= extremely small pieces) of a substance moving and mixing together with others: Radiation is scattered diffusively in all directions. This allows iron to "bleed" diffusively upwards and outwards from a discrete point.
More examplesFewer examplesAt a microscopic level, the tumour cells are diffusively distributed.Each molecule is interacting mechanically, but not diffusively.The radiation is diffusively transported into the dense matter.These bodies of water are assumed to exchange properties diffusively.
